sources.data_found: U Supercharges AI Computing Power with New GPUs: The University of Utah Center for High Performance Computing recently installed its single-biggest upgrade to AI cyberinfrastructure: a fleet of 10 powerful computer servers with 80 high-end NVIDIA graphics processing units (GPUs). 10 servers × 8 GPUs/server = 80 GPUs total.
Granite User Guide: 3 GPU nodes, each with 64 (Genoa AMD) cores, 1 with 768GB of memory and 2 with 384GB of memory. One node contains H100NVL GPUs and 2 nodes contain L40S GPUs.

GPUs and Accelerators at CHPC: The CHPC provides GPU devices on the granite (grn), notchpeak (np), kingspeak (kp), lonepeak (lp), and redwood (rw) clusters. General nodes on notchpeak, kingspeak, lonepeak and redwood clusters. All users have free access to these nodes. General nodes on the granite cluster: an allocation is required to use these GPUs.
Example freegpus output: $ freegpus -p notchpeak-gpu GPUS_FREE: notchpeak-gpu v100 (x1) 2080ti (x9) 3090 (x2) a100 (x2)

The CompSci Major at University of Utah: During the 2021-2022 academic year, University of Utah handed out 219 bachelor's degrees in computer science. In 2022, 40 students received their master's degree in compsci from U of U.

University of Utah Data USA: In 2023, 9,493 degrees were awarded across all undergraduate and graduate programs at University of Utah. The most common positions for non-instructional staff include Computer, Engineering, and Science with 851 employees.

student_data.notes: Based on 2021-2022 data showing 219 bachelor's degrees awarded and 40 master's degrees. Using standard 4-year program for undergrad and 2-year for MS: undergrad enrolled = 219 × 4 = 876; MS enrolled = 40 × 2 = 80. PhD enrollment estimated at 80 based on typical program size, for total graduate enrollment of 160.

other_high_vram_gpus.notes: Shown in freegpus output for notchpeak-gpu partition
Shown in freegpus output for notchpeak-gpu partition

gpu_resources.notes:
CALCULATION DETAILS:

1) One-U RAI Initiative GPUs: 10 servers × 8 GPUs/server = 80 H100 GPUs (counted as H100 SXM based on 'high-end' designation)

2) Granite Cluster: 3 GPU nodes total - 1 node with H100NVL GPUs (likely 2 based on NVL configuration), 2 nodes with L40S GPUs (likely 8 each = 16 total)

3) Notchpeak Cluster (from freegpus output): 1 V100, 9 RTX 2080Ti, 2 RTX 3090, 2 A100

FINAL TOTALS:
- H100 SXM: 80 (RAI servers)
- A100 (assumed 80GB): 2 (notchpeak)
- L40S: 16 (granite estimated)
- V100: 1 (notchpeak)
- RTX 2080 Ti: 9 (notchpeak)
- RTX 3090: 2 (notchpeak)

Note: Exact counts for some clusters not fully specified in public documentation.

analysis_notes: University of Utah CHPC made major investment in AI infrastructure in 2024 with 80 H100 GPUs through One-U RAI Initiative. Additional GPUs available across multiple clusters (granite, notchpeak, kingspeak, lonepeak, redwood) but exact inventories not fully public.
